channel.title: My Pure Ranger
channel.description:
OK I just started a new pure ranger, put 4k iron arrows on it, and I'm ready to go... I'm just not quite sure where to train.
I would love some of your guys' suggestions! ;D
BTW, his name is •Range V9• and I'm very bored.. So if your on, talk to me :P

item.title: My Pure Ranger
item.dc:creator: @ninjasod ninjasod
item.description:
@ninjasod wrote:

xxlegitxx:

Iron arrows are worthless in the long run. And my point was there aren’t good range spots…

Not entirely, theyre good if youre going to grind for a long time, seeing as theyre pretty cheap.[br][size=1]Posted on: February 06, 2007, 07:29:45 PM[/size][hr][quote=“labob, post:28, topic:49411”]my dad knows more about rs than all your dads put together[/quote]

  1. This has no point in being posted.
  2. Why would I want a geeky dad?
    You’re dad sends a whole new meaning to the song “White and Nerdy”

Read full topic

item.title: My Pure Ranger
item.dc:creator: @ninjasod ninjasod
item.description:
@ninjasod wrote:

3 people to like 8 monks is not crowded, especially if you’re one of those 3.
When I goto monks, there is never a soul there.
3 people to 12 chickens is crowded, seeing how people can 1 hit a chicken and move to another.
Cows are always crowded now.
I said something about 1-20 for hobgoblins.
Goblins DO NOT DROP ARROWS.
Minotaurs DO DROP ARROWS.
That makes it so you can eventually grind longer with ranging on minotaurs.
I’ve gotten a range from lvl 1 to 50 in 2 days from grinding on monks to 15 then minotaurs to 35, then pest control until 50.

Read full topic

item.title: My Pure Ranger
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Monks usually have 3 people there on a good world. Crowded.
Chickens rarely have more than 3 people to 12 chickens.
Cows are much less crowded than monks.
No one said anything about 1-20 for hobgoblins.
Goblins are easier to train on because of the N-S orientation. If you have arrows, it takes less time to kill goblins because you don’t have to wait for them to spawn, nor do you have to run around if they hit you. And lvl 16 goblins have the same hp as minotaurs, giving ~100 exp per kill.

Read full topic

item.title: My Pure Ranger
item.dc:creator: @ninjasod ninjasod
item.description:
@ninjasod wrote:

Monks arent crowded if you goto the right world, but ultimately bad exp for ranging.
And also, Moss Giants are crowded…
Chickens = 12 exp per kill, and crowded usually because of fletching/fly fishing
Cows = crowded
Hobgoblins = good to train on from a certain level to a certain level, but definately not starting at level 1-20 otherwise you won’t hit most of the time.
Barbarians = okay if you find a un-crowded world
Stronghold of Security ~ Goblins = Level 27 minotaurs are better.

Read full topic

[/quote]

And you’re a douchebag who knows shit about RS.[/quote]
Yeah, I do know about RS.
Minotaurs own goblins, not only do minotaurs drop iron arrows that you can train with, they have weak defense, and have more spawns than goblins…

Read full topic

item.title: My Pure Ranger
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

PaulT:

Minotaurs are actually the best bang for your buck, since their is a convenient barrier and they drop iron arrows.

It’s not too convenient. I’ve trained 2 pure ranges to level 40, and goblins are the best. The thing about minotaurs is that the barrier is east-west, not north-south.

Read full topic

item.title: My Pure Ranger
item.dc:creator: @ninjasod ninjasod
item.description:
@ninjasod wrote:

I’d say train range on goblins or the monks at the monastery until about lvl 10 or so.
Then goto Security StrongHold and train on the lvl 12 minotaurs until about 20-22.
Then goto the lvl 27 minotaurs and train on them for a bit.
The lvl 27’s give 88 exp per kill, so using rapid on them is a good idea for good grinding.
I hope youre ranger owns

Read full topic
